name: Lynx
headline: AI platform for investigating and resolving engineering incidents
description: Lynx is an AI platform that investigates and resolves engineering issues directly in your environment, from data anomalies to production outages. When incidents arise, Lynx will automatically gather information, pinpoint root causes, and execute solutions. Lynx makes incident resolution faster and more reliable, so teams can minimize downtime and focus on building.
markdown:
raw_markdown="[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6733cc4982ef7c6b93a7a359_lynx_full_dark_back_cc.svg)](https://uselynx.ai/</>)[Features](https://uselynx.ai/<https:/www.uselynx.ai/#features>)[Pricing](https://uselynx.ai/</pricing>)[FAQ](https://uselynx.ai/<https:/www.uselynx.ai/#faq>)[Contact](https://uselynx.ai/</contact>)
[Sign in](https://uselynx.ai/<https:/web.uselynx.ai>)[Get started](https://uselynx.ai/</getstarted>)
# AI-PoweredIncident Resolution
Stop dreading your on-call shifts.Lynx is here to help.
[Get started](https://uselynx.ai/<https:/www.uselynx.ai/getstarted>)[Learn more](https://uselynx.ai/<#features>)
Why is my health check failing?
Revert the commit.
Are there any spikes in CPU or memory usage?
What other services are failing?
Roll back to the last stable deployment.
Graph traffic for the last minute.
Generate a runbook for this investigation.
Route this incident to the right team.
Give me the application logs on the server.
Will this incident auto-resolve?
What's the status of my Kubernetes cluster?
What are the latest logs?
Run diagnostics on the load balancer.
Update the service configuration files.
Are there user-reported bugs related to this incident?
Monitor network latency issues.
Check the database connection settings.
Validate the SSL certificates.
Is the API endpoint responding correctly?
Schedule a maintenance window.
What's causing the sudden traffic surge?
Alert the on-call engineer.
Analyze the error logs for exceptions.
Is there a dependency outage?
Test the backup and restore process.
Restart the failed pods.
Enable verbose logging for troubleshooting.
Deploy the latest security patches.
Help me debug my CI pipeline.
Review recent code merges.
Incident Resolution Platform
## Automated root cause resolution
![Zap icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6ac_zap.svg)
### Instant analysis
Lynx instantly begins analyzing incidents as soon as they occur. When you're ready to investigate, all the context you need is at your fingertips.
![Rocket icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6c7_rocket.svg)
### Action-driven resolution
Lynx doesn’t just give you insights—it can directly resolve issues in your code and infrastructure, driving toward reliable and effective solutions.
Comprehensive Awareness
## Real-time code and infra understanding
![Magic icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b2_wand-sparkles.svg)
### Chain-of-thought execution
Adaptive context retrieval automatically pulls in all the critical real-time information from your infrastructure, logs, pipelines, and codebase.
![Dashboard icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b3_layout-dashboard.svg)
### All the integrations
Lynx connects with all the tools and integrations in your environment, providing seamless, end-to-end support for all your needs.
Seamless Integration
## Embedded directly in your environment
![Panel icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b7_panels-top-left.svg)
### Integrated unix shell
Connect to your environment and initiate sessions to directly run commands and execute code on your machines.
![Sliders icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b0_sliders-horizontal.svg)
### Safe execution controls
AI-driven risk detection, role-based access controls (RBAC), audit logging, and command approvals ensure safe and secure execution across your environment.
Enhanced Collaboration
## Bring your teamtogether
![Handshake icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6bf_handshake.svg)
### Get help from your team
Route incidents to the right people, or loop experts in. Lynx figures out who has the most context to solve the incident.
![Chart icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6aa_chart-no-axes-combined.svg)
### Publish your workflows
Share your investigation - resolution steps are automatically logged, and can even be transformed into runbooks and postmortems.
## Integrations
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6731a52ca5d91f106722bb97_pgpgpgpg.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6731af0ad194b61c31a63073_623370ca0a8c5486bbea2500_amazon-web-services-aws-white-text%5B1%5D.svg)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/67318ac0ff40e81cde8a482e_gcloud-removebg-preview.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/67318d12f9849bb1e3811112_Azure-Logo-Horizontal%402x.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6731ac06930907d51aa87252_datadog.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6731aa3a21361b4c6cdb46a9_grafana-logo.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6731ade2738a0e2b0f315aa6_logo-removebg-preview.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6731a5d00fce48fafaffddfa_987e55b5ac8a7ded1da4903dbff2a76e.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6731ab2423f7d13e55b9521a_5e6e7634a2ae972a2a2e49dc_kubernetes-horizontal-white.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6731adfaff40e81cdea7711c_Docker-Logo-1.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/673189965a80fcb0f17d9c0e_8501d7ac-0447-44f2-a0e3-f48a706b21b2.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/673189965efdc93267727656_Terraform_PrimaryLogo_ColorWhite_RGB-e1702345172999.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/67318ac021361b4c6cc111ee_slack.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/67318ac07a8143745f708983_image__5_-removebg-preview.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/67318997696ea7dfd8da7ab4_gitlab.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/673538ac17839c05c6e8f7c2_jira.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/673538f0c203ed27c1b06c07_teams.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/6735388a6526672036151504_and%20more.png)
## FAQs
Answers to questions you might have about Lynx.
### What does Lynx do?
![Plus icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b5_plus.svg)
Lynx is an AI-powered incident resolution platform that allows engineers to easily investigate and resolve issues directly in your environment. When incidents come in, Lynx can automatically gather information, offer resolutions, and even perform actions to help engineers fix the problem. It’s built to make the investigation process more efficient and reliable, so companies experience less disruption and engineers have more time to focus on building.
### Who is Lynx for?
![Plus icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b5_plus.svg)
Lynx is built for engineering and DevOps teams who need a reliable, efficient way to manage incidents and resolve issues, especially those who experience the high demands of on-call rotations. It's ideal for organizations looking to reduce incident response times and ease the burdens of on-call work.
### **How can I deploy Lynx?**
![Plus icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b5_plus.svg)
Lynx is designed for flexible deployment, adapting easily to your preferred setup. It can be installed directly on engineers’ cloud-based dev servers or on a dedicated cluster with minimal configuration needed:
‍
  1. Creating your individual or organization account.
  2. Authorize Lynx to connect with your development environment (instructions vary by cloud provider and infrastructure configuration).
  3. Run a provided script to install Lynx onto your machines. Lynx will automatically learn and optimize for your environment.


Our team is available to guide you through every step for a seamless deployment experience.
### **Can I deploy Lynx on-prem or in my private cloud?**
![Plus icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b5_plus.svg)
Yes, Lynx can be deployed both on-premises or in your private cloud, making it a secure choice for organizations with stringent data protection requirements.We can also support your own LLM API tokens or custom model configurations, as well as on-prem models, giving you flexibility in managing your data and integrations.Please reach out to our team to discuss your unique requirements.
### **Is Lynx safe?**
![Plus icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b5_plus.svg)
Absolutely. Lynx is built with enterprise-grade security measures to ensure data protection and operational safety within your environment:
‍
  * **End-to-End Encryption** : All data transmitted to and from Lynx is protected with end-to-end encryption (AES-256 for data at rest and TLS 1.3 for data in transit), ensuring that only authorized users can access sensitive information.
  * **Data Segmentation and Isolation** : Each customer’s data is logically segmented and isolated within our infrastructure, preventing any unauthorized access across tenants. We never train models with customer data.
  * **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and Single sign-on (SSO) Support** : Lynx supports MFA and integrates with leading SSO providers to ensure secure and streamlined access control.
  * **Customer-Controlled Data Retention Policies** : Lynx provides customizable data retention policies so that customers can define how long their data should be stored, aligning with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.


In addition to our SaaS offering, we offer on-prem and private cloud deployments.To prevent any risk of executing dangerous code, Lynx includes the following safeguards:
‍
  * **Access Controls and Permissions** : Lynx enforces strict role-based access control (RBAC) so you can define precisely who can trigger certain actions. Engineers can grant specific permissions for investigative tasks while restricting access to sensitive operations or data.
  * **Command and Integration Blacklisting** : Lynx allows you to define restricted (blacklisted) commands and integrations that prevent unauthorized or potentially harmful actions from being executed within your environment.
  * **Execution Sandboxing** : Lynx can be deployed to isolated execution environments, so access is limited to only necessary system resources and data.
  * **Validation and Review Protocols** : Before executing commands, Lynx performs validation checks, including dependency and output verification, to confirm they align with pre-defined parameters. Critical actions require multi-step verification, allowing engineers to review and approve commands before they are run.
  * **Comprehensive Logging and Monitoring** : Lynx logs all activity and provides real-time monitoring so that any unexpected actions can be identified and reviewed immediately.


With these controls, Lynx operates securely within your environment, empowering teams to resolve issues efficiently while protecting critical systems and data.
### **How can I get started?**
![Plus icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/672dd1aa754059853812a5dd/672dd1aa754059853812a6b5_plus.svg)
Reach out for a demo to see Lynx in action, or connect with our team to discuss your unique requirements and deployment options. We’re here to help you set up and start reducing incident response times from day one.
[Get started](https://uselynx.ai/</getstarted>)[Contact Us](https://uselynx.ai/</contact>)

## FAQs
Answers to questions you might have about Lynx.
### What does Lynx do?
![Plus icon⟨18⟩]
Lynx is an AI-powered incident resolution platform that allows engineers to easily investigate and resolve issues directly in your environment. When incidents come in, Lynx can automatically gather information, offer resolutions, and even perform actions to help engineers fix the problem. It’s built to make the investigation process more efficient and reliable, so companies experience less disruption and engineers have more time to focus on building.
### Who is Lynx for?
![Plus icon⟨18⟩]
Lynx is built for engineering and DevOps teams who need a reliable, efficient way to manage incidents and resolve issues, especially those who experience the high demands of on-call rotations. It's ideal for organizations looking to reduce incident response times and ease the burdens of on-call work.
### **How can I deploy Lynx?**
![Plus icon⟨18⟩]
Lynx is designed for flexible deployment, adapting easily to your preferred setup. It can be installed directly on engineers’ cloud-based dev servers or on a dedicated cluster with minimal configuration needed:
‍
  1. Creating your individual or organization account.
  2. Authorize Lynx to connect with your development environment (instructions vary by cloud provider and infrastructure configuration).
  3. Run a provided script to install Lynx onto your machines. Lynx will automatically learn and optimize for your environment.


Our team is available to guide you through every step for a seamless deployment experience.
### **Can I deploy Lynx on-prem or in my private cloud?**
![Plus icon⟨18⟩]
Yes, Lynx can be deployed both on-premises or in your private cloud, making it a secure choice for organizations with stringent data protection requirements.We can also support your own LLM API tokens or custom model configurations, as well as on-prem models, giving you flexibility in managing your data and integrations.Please reach out to our team to discuss your unique requirements.
### **Is Lynx safe?**
![Plus icon⟨18⟩]
Absolutely. Lynx is built with enterprise-grade security measures to ensure data protection and operational safety within your environment:
‍
  * **End-to-End Encryption** : All data transmitted to and from Lynx is protected with end-to-end encryption (AES-256 for data at rest and TLS 1.3 for data in transit), ensuring that only authorized users can access sensitive information.
  * **Data Segmentation and Isolation** : Each customer’s data is logically segmented and isolated within our infrastructure, preventing any unauthorized access across tenants. We never train models with customer data.
  * **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and Single sign-on (SSO) Support** : Lynx supports MFA and integrates with leading SSO providers to ensure secure and streamlined access control.
  * **Customer-Controlled Data Retention Policies** : Lynx provides customizable data retention policies so that customers can define how long their data should be stored, aligning with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.


In addition to our SaaS offering, we offer on-prem and private cloud deployments.To prevent any risk of executing dangerous code, Lynx includes the following safeguards:
‍
  * **Access Controls and Permissions** : Lynx enforces strict role-based access control (RBAC) so you can define precisely who can trigger certain actions. Engineers can grant specific permissions for investigative tasks while restricting access to sensitive operations or data.
  * **Command and Integration Blacklisting** : Lynx allows you to define restricted (blacklisted) commands and integrations that prevent unauthorized or potentially harmful actions from being executed within your environment.
  * **Execution Sandboxing** : Lynx can be deployed to isolated execution environments, so access is limited to only necessary system resources and data.
  * **Validation and Review Protocols** : Before executing commands, Lynx performs validation checks, including dependency and output verification, to confirm they align with pre-defined parameters. Critical actions require multi-step verification, allowing engineers to review and approve commands before they are run.
  * **Comprehensive Logging and Monitoring** : Lynx logs all activity and provides real-time monitoring so that any unexpected actions can be identified and reviewed immediately.


With these controls, Lynx operates securely within your environment, empowering teams to resolve issues efficiently while protecting critical systems and data.
### **How can I get started?**
![Plus icon⟨18⟩]
Reach out for a demo to see Lynx in action, or connect with our team to discuss your unique requirements and deployment options. We’re here to help you set up and start reducing incident response times from day one.

generated_description:
### Company Overview: Lynx

**Name**: Lynx  
**Founded**: 2023  
**Location**: San Francisco  
**Team Size**: 5 employees  
**Y Combinator Batch**: W23  
**Group Partner**: Michael Seibel  
**Website**: [Lynx](https://uselynx.ai)

#### Mission

Lynx has set out to revolutionize how engineering incidents are managed. It’s an AI-driven platform specifically designed for investigating and resolving engineering issues. Whether it's data anomalies or production outages, Lynx aims to streamline incident resolution, allowing teams to reduce downtime and concentrate on what they do best—building.

#### What Does Lynx Do?

When a disruption occurs, Lynx swings into action. The platform automatically collects relevant data, identifies root causes, and can even implement fixes right in the user's environment. This not only speeds up incident response but makes it more reliable, which is a game-changer for engineering and DevOps teams, especially those burdened with on-call duties.

#### Key Features

- **Instant Analysis**: Lynx kicks off real-time incident analysis, gathering all necessary context from the onset of an issue.
- **Action-Driven Resolution**: It's not just about insights; Lynx can actively implement solutions, addressing problems directly in code and infrastructure.
- **Comprehensive Awareness**: It pulls in real-time data from your infrastructure, logs, and codebase, ensuring nothing gets missed during investigations.
- **Seamless Integration**: Lynx integrates with your existing tools and setups, keeping everything in sync.
- **Enhanced Collaboration**: The platform intelligently routes incidents to the appropriate team members, leveraging their contextual knowledge to solve issues faster.

#### Who Is Lynx For?

This platform is tailor-made for engineering and DevOps teams. If your team suffers from long incident resolution times and the strain of on-call rotations, Lynx is designed to lighten that load.

#### Deployment & Security

Lynx is flexible in its deployment options, seamlessly integrating into cloud environments or on-premises systems. Its architecture emphasizes security with enterprise-grade measures, such as end-to-end encryption and robust access controls. This ensures that engineers can resolve issues safely without compromising sensitive data.

#### Getting Started

For organizations looking to streamline their incident resolution processes, Lynx invites teams to schedule a demo. Their goal is to get you up and running quickly so your engineering team can start minimizing downtime from day one.

#### Conclusion

In a nutshell, Lynx sets itself apart as an intelligent ally to engineering teams, transforming how incidents are tackled, making them quicker to resolve, providing clarity and confidence. If you're ready to elevate your incident response game, Lynx may just be the solution you're looking for. Visit [Lynx](https://uselynx.ai) to learn more.
